subject: lamp test: Add vritual lamp test function
commitMessage:
lamp test: Add vritual lamp test function

- This feature adds the functionality that enables force updating
  certain physical LEDs and skip updating certain physical LEDs as
  part of lamp test.

- This is a generic feature that gives more control over handing
  physical LEDs.

Signed-off-by: George Liu <liuxiwei@inspur.com>
Change-Id: I6f06ed103b1ceefdaa774b7a74a4a392609000ed

This feature adds the functionality that enables force updating certain physical LEDs and skip updating certain physical LEDs as part of lamp test. This is a generic feature that gives more control over handling physical LEDs.
JSON having list of physical LEDs that will be updated during lamp test overriding lamp-test needs
JSON having list of physical LEDs that are exempted from lamp test
json file having led names that will be forcibly updated during lamp test
json file having led names that will be skipped during lamp test
please fix the comment(s) in this file
force ?>. it's actually the name of the led right ?
The order must always be Deassert and then Assert
do we really need to crash ?.. not really.. this can be just an error

Vector of names of physical LEDs, whose changes will be forcibly updated even during lamp test.

forUpdateLEDs

vector of names of physical LEDs, that will be exempted from lamp test

skipUpdateLEDs
Get physical LED names from lamp test json config file
it's not physical path right .. just the name of physical LED.
please move endif to this line. There is a new line here that is not needed
sorry, was my previous comment addressed ?..

https://gerrit.openbmc-project.xyz/c/openbmc/phosphor-led-manager/+/38521/32/lamptest.hpp#42
I have removed it and used Manager::group
hmm.. we should do this _only_ if lamp test is running. Otherwise, the regular driveLED() will handle this case.

we don't have to use the word "Asset". we can call it physicalLEDStatesPriorToLampTest
should we call it skipLed instead of "skip" ?

/** @brief Physical LED states prior to lamp test */
JSON file having LED names that will be force updated and/or skipped during lamp test
Please fix this line too with the updated text.
could you explain this to me again?  ledsDeAssert contains the LEDs to turn off, but this will only actually turn them off in they are in forceUpdateLEDs... why is that?  same question below.

There is a situation:
The physical LED needs to be updated during the lamp test, at this time, we only need to update the "forceLEDs" physical LED, and other physical LEDs needs to be saved to the queue, and will be restored after the lamp test is stop.

In other words, "forceLEDs" is to always be consistent with the state of the physical LEDs
I totally missed this.. need to handle `skipList` the same way as it was done in `start()`
